page.title: 03Derivation of Fairford
page.content: Fairford first got its name from the old ford in the River Coln.The name {"Fair"}means easy to cross.The ford was made about 900 years ago,which was in the Saxon times.The Saxon word for Fairford is{Fagranforda.}Where the river divides,the piece of grass in the middle is called the{Chalice {Piece. } The Chalice belonged to the Church at that time.Drovers taking cattle along the roads from one place to another used the ford .They would throw coins in the ford for good luck.There were wide verges for the cattle to walk on, which also provided food on their journeys.
